Artificial Intelligence Index Report 2025

The Artificial Intelligence Index Report 2025, the eighth edition of this influential report, provides a comprehensive analysis of the rapidly evolving landscape of artificial intelligence. Released at a critical juncture, as AI's impact on society, the economy, and global governance continues to grow exponentially, this report represents the most detailed iteration to date. Key additions and expansions include in-depth investigations into the emerging trends of AI hardware, offering novel estimations of inference costs, and a thorough examination of AI publication and patenting patterns. Furthermore, the report incorporates fresh data concerning corporate adoption of responsible AI practices, alongside significantly broadened coverage of AI's increasing significance within scientific research and the medical field. Established in 2017 as a derivative of the One Hundred Year Study of Artificial Intelligence, the AI Index has consistently aimed to provide policymakers, journalists, executives, researchers, and the general public with reliable, rigorously verified, and globally sourced data. The core mission remains steadfast: to empower these stakeholders with the information necessary to make well-informed decisions regarding the development and implementation of AI technologies. Given the pervasive discussion surrounding AI ‚Äì from corporate boardrooms to everyday conversations ‚Äì this mission is now more vital than ever. The AI Index continues to be a leader in monitoring and interpreting the most crucial trends shaping the field, encompassing the dynamic geopolitical environment, the accelerated advancement of underlying technologies, and AI's expanding influence across business, policy, and public life. Longitudinal tracking remains a fundamental component of the Index's methodology, ensuring a continuous understanding of the field's evolution. The report's data is designed to facilitate strategic decision-making and promote responsible innovation in the AI domain.

Key Concepts:

  • Tracking and interpreting AI trends
  • Data-driven decision making for AI stakeholders
  • Longitudinal tracking of AI development
  • Impact of AI on society, economy, and governance
  • The AI Index is a report conceived within the One Hundred Year Study on Artificial Intelligence.
  • AI tools (ChatGPT and Claude) were used to assist in the editing and copy editing of the AI Index report.
  • The report was authored by a team of human researchers with AI assistance.
  • Significant improvement in AI video generation quality
  • Reduction in model size leading to improved performance
  • Challenges in complex reasoning and problem-solving for LLMs
